3 Terms, definitions and abbreviated terms
3.1 Terms defined in ISO 10303-31
For the purposes of this document, the following terms defined in ISO 10303-1 apply:
abstract test case;
abstract test method;
conformance testing;
test purpose;
verdict;
verdict criteria;
3.2 Other terms and definitions For the purposes of this document, the following terms and definitions apply:
3.2.1
abstract test suite
a part of this International Standard that contains the set of abstract test cases necessary for conformance testing of an implementation of an application protocol.
3.2.2
application
a group of one or more processes creating or using product data.
3.2.3
application activity model
AAM
a model that describes an application in terms of its processes and information flows.
3.2.4
application context
the environment in which the integrated resources are interpreted to support the use of product data in a specific application.
3.2.5
application interpreted construct
AIC
logical grouping of interpreted constructs that supports a specific function for the usage of product data across multiple application contexts
3.2.6
application interpreted model
AIM
an information model that uses the integrated resources necessary to satisfy the information requirements and constraints of an application reference model, within an application protocol.
3.2.7
application object
an atomic element of an application reference model that defines a unique concept of the application and contains attributes specifying the data elements of the object.
3.2.8
application module
AM
reusable collection of a scope statement, information requirements, mappings and module interpreted model that supports a specific usage of product data across multiple application contexts
3.2.9
application protocol
AP
a part of this International Standard that specifies an application interpreted model satisfying the scope and information requirements for a specific application.
NOTE - This definition differs from the definition used in open system interconnection (OSI) standards. However, since this International Standard is not intended to be used directly with OS1 communications, no confusion should arise.
3.2.10
application reference model
ARM
an information model that describes the information requirements and constraints of a specific application context
3.2.11
application resource
an integrated resource whose contents are related to a group of application contexts.
3.2.12
assembly
a product that is decomposable into a set of components or other assemblies from the perspective of a specific application.
3.2.13
common resources
collection of information models, specified in EXPRESS language, that can be reused to specify application specific information models within the domain of industrial data
NOTE The resource constructs defined by application modules are those defined in their MIM schema.
3.2.14
component
a product that is not subject to decomposition from the perspective of a specific application.
3.2.15
conformance class
a subset of an application protocol for which conformance may be claimed.
3.2.16
conformance option
a subset of an application protocol for which conformance may be claimed in addition to the conformance claimed for a conformance class. ???
3.2.17
conformance requirement
a precise, text definition of a characteristic required to be present in a conforming implementation.
3.2.18
data
a representation of information in a formal manner suitable for communication, interpretation, or processing by human beings or computers.
3.2.19
data exchange
the storing, accessing, transferring, and archiving of data.
3.2.20
data specification language
a set of rules for defining data and their relationships suitable for communication, interpretation, or processing by computers.
3.2.21
exchange structure
a computer-interpretable format used for storing, accessing, transferring, and archiving data.
3.2.22
generic resource
an integrated resource whose contents are context-independent.
3.2.23
implementation method
a part of this International Standard that specifies a technique used by computer systems to exchange product data that is described using the EXPREESS data specification language [ISO 10303- 11].
3.2.24
information
facts, concepts, or instructions.
3.2.25
information model
a formal model of a bounded set of facts, concepts or instructions to meet a specified requirement.
3.2.26
integrated resource
IR
a part of this International Standard that defines a group of resource constructs used as the basis for product data.
3.2.27
interpretation
the process of adapting a resource construct from the integrated resources to satisfy a requirement of an application protocol. This may involve the addition of restrictions on attributes, the addition of constraints, the addition of relationships among resource constructs and application constructs, or all of the above.
3.2.28
module interpreted model
MIM
information model that uses the common resources necessary to satisfy the information requirements and constraints of an application reference model, within an application module
3.2.29
PICS proforma
a standardized document in the form of a questionnaire, which, when completed for a particular implementation, becomes the protocol implementation conformance statement.
3.2.30
presentation
a recognizable visual representation of product data.
3.2.31
product
a thing or substance produced by a natural or artificial process.
3.2.32
product data
a representation of information about a product in a formal manner suitable for communication, interpretation, or processing by human beings or by computers.
3.2.33
product information
facts, concepts, or instructions about a product.
3.2.34
product information model
an information model which provides an abstract description of facts, concepts and instructions about a product.
3.2.35
protocol implementation conformance statement
PICS
a statement of which capabilities and options are supported within an implementation of a given standard. This statement is produced by completing a PICS proforma.
3.2.36
resource construct
a collection of EXPRESS language entities, types, functions, rules and references that together define a valid description of an aspect of product data.
3.2.37
structure
a set of interrelated parts of any complex thing, and the relationships between them.
3.2.38
unit of functionality
UOF
a collection of application objects and their relationships that defines one or more concepts within the application context such that removal of any component would render the concepts incomplete or ambiguous.
3.3 Abbreviated terms
For the purposes of this document, the following abbreviated terms apply:
AIC application interpreted construct
AM application module
ARM application reference model
IR integrated resource
